definitions.text:
Hearken
 h'arken.
1. To listen; to lend the ear; to attend to what is uttered, with eagerness or curiosity. The furies hearken and their snakes uncurl.
2. To attend; to regard; to give heed to what is uttered; to observe or obey. Hearken, O Israel, to the statutes and the judgments which I teach you. Deuteronomy 4:1.
3. To listen; ; to attend; to grant or comply with. thou to the supplication of thy servant.l Kings
8.
h'arken. To hear by listening. [Little Used.]
